sections.interactive_description: evaluate the effectiveness of sample enhancement activities

sections.content: What: Enhancement Activities (EAs) are mandatory special educational events that happen outside of students’ regular Access classes throughout the duration of the program. EAs are interactive opportunities for students to enhance their English language skills and personal skills.
There are four main topics for Enhancement Activities:

Who: Access teachers (in consultation with the U.S. Embassy) plan and facilitate enhancement activities for Access students. Administrators support both students and teachers. Don’t forget to invite U.S. Embassy representatives and/or your RELO in advance!
Where: EAs can occur within students’ regular Access classroom or they can occur outside of the classroom (in the program’s host city or nearby city/area).
When: EAs must occur at least once per semester or quarter.

Why: EAs are often the most memorable experiences for Access students as they usually occur outside the classroom and encourage the development of community. EAs should be carefully designed to advance the students’ English skills AND reinforce a topic by creating a lasting impression and memory for students.

Enhancement Activities.definition: Enhancement activities are mandatory special eduational events that happen outside of students’ regular Access classes throughout the duration of the program.
